metadata.title: 1. 5 Things Most People Learn Too Late In Life
metadata.desc: Life is a journey of twists and turns, peaks and valleys, mountains to climb and oceans to explore. Good times and bad times. Happy times and sad times. But always, life is a movement forward.

metadata.title: 2. Top 3 Books for Every Data Science Engineer
metadata.desc: In college, I was not too fond of textbooks. But since graduating and working full-time, I have found myself collecting books on data science and software engineering to keep at my desk for work. I was developing a small library of references that I can look to when working through a problem or learning about a specific area. The three books I have found the most helpful to date are Clean Code, An Introduction to Statistical Learning, and 40 Algorithms Every Programmer Should Know.

metadata.title: 4. Hamari Kahani Secret
metadata.desc: EXPLAINED : An IT professional while getting ready for work, gazed in the mirror and noticed a grey strand of hair.

metadata.title: 5. Road Less Cycled EXPLAINED
metadata.desc: SECRET Once a man was riding a cycle and noticed another rider about half a mile ahead of him.

metadata.title: 6. Remember AUDI!
metadata.desc: I reminded him of the words that he had spoken to me from his wheelchair as I laid helpless in my hospital bed last year with an amoebic liver abscess.

metadata.title: 7. The Rising Sunset
metadata.desc: One day a professor entered the classroom and asked his students to prepare for a surprise test

metadata.title: 8. Duty in Despair
metadata.desc: Once during a famine, a desperate man stepped out of his house to earn a living.  He came across a fruit farm
